title: 110_hr3513
content: The "Copper Salmon Wilderness Act of 2008" designates the Copper Salmon Wilderness. The Oregon Wilderness Act of 1984 is amended to designate the Copper Salmon Wilderness, comprising approximately 11,922 acres in the Siskiyou National Forest. The Secretary of Agriculture is required to file a map and legal description of the wilderness with the Senate and House Committees on Energy and Natural Resources. The Copper Salmon Wilderness, totaling 11,922 acres in the Siskiyou National Forest, is designated under the Oregon Wilderness Act of 1984. The Secretary of Agriculture must submit a map and legal description to the Senate and House Committees on Energy and Natural Resources. The filed documents will have the same legal force as the Act, with the Secretary allowed to correct typographical errors. Public inspection of the documents will be available at Forest Service offices. If the wilderness boundary abuts a road, the Secretary can establish an offset up to 150 feet from the road's centerline. SEC. 3. WILD AND SCENIC RIVER DESIGNATIONS, ELK RIVER, OREGON. Section 3(a)(76) of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act is amended to designate specific segments of the North Fork Elk and South Fork Elk rivers in Oregon as scenic or wild rivers. The Wild and Scenic Rivers Act designates specific segments of the North Fork Elk and South Fork Elk rivers in Oregon as scenic or wild rivers, including a 4.2-mile segment of the South Fork Elk as a wild river. SEC. 4. PROTECTION OF TRIBAL RIGHTS. This Act does not diminish any rights of Indian tribes. The Secretary aims to make an agreement with the Coquille Indian Tribe for access to the Copper Salmon Wilderness for historical and cultural activities. SEC. 5. DESIGNATION OF POTENTIAL WILDERNESS AREA, SISKIYOU NATIONAL FOREST, OREGON. Designation of certain National Forest System land in Oregon as a potential wilderness area for inclusion in the Copper Salmon Wilderness. The Secretary will file a map and legal description of the designated area with the relevant committees. The Secretary may correct errors in the map and description, with the map controlling in case of discrepancies. The potential wilderness area will be managed by the Secretary until designated as wilderness. Ecological restoration may involve the use of motorized equipment until wilderness designation. The potential wilderness area will be managed by the Secretary until designated as wilderness. Ecological restoration may involve the use of motorized equipment until wilderness designation. The Secretary shall use the minimum tool necessary for restoration with minimal impact on wilderness character and resources. The potential wilderness area will be designated as wilderness within 10 years or when conditions incompatible with the Wilderness Act are removed. Upon designation, it will be incorporated into the Copper Salmon Wilderness for administration. Upon designation as wilderness under subsection (e), the potential wilderness area will be incorporated into the Copper Salmon Wilderness and managed in accordance with relevant laws, including the Wilderness Act and the Oregon Wilderness Act of 1984. Any references in the Wilderness Act to its effective date will apply to the date of designation under subsection (e). The House of Representatives passed the bill on April 22, 2008. Attest: LORRAINE C. MILLER, Clerk.
